sentences.text: Northern Trust Corporation 50 South La Salle Street Chicago, Illinois 60603 March 16, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dear Stockholder:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are cordially invited to attend the Northern Trust Corporation 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders on Tuesday, April 25, 2017, at 10:30 a.m., Central Time, at our corporate headquarters at 50 South La Salle Street in Chicago, Illinois.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more than 125 years, our stockholders support has been essential to Northern Trusts stability and success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote plays a vital role and is very important for our future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether or not you plan to attend the Annual Meeting, I urge you to vote your shares as promptly as possible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The attached Notice of Annual Meeting of Stockholders and Proxy Statement provide you with information about each proposal to be considered at the Annual Meeting, as well as other information you may find useful in voting your shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you plan to attend the Annual Meeting, please review the information on admittance procedures in the accompanying Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you choose not to attend in person, you may vote your shares by Internet or telephone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you received a paper copy of the proxy materials, you also may complete, sign, date, and return your proxy card in the enclosed envelope.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instructions for voting by Internet or telephone can be found on your proxy card or your Notice Regarding the Availability of Proxy Materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thank you for your continued support of Northern Trust Corporation, and your contribution to the future of our company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Frederick H. Waddell Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NOTICE OF ANNUAL MEETING OF STOCKHOLDERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tuesday, April 25, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 10:30 a.m., Central Time
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purposes of the Annual Meeting are to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: elect thirteen directors to serve on the Board of Directors until the 2018 Annual Meeting of Stockholders or until their successors are elected and qualified;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: approve, by an advisory vote, 2016 named executive officer compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: hold an advisory vote on the frequency with which the Corporation should hold advisory votes on executive compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: approve the Northern Trust Corporation 2017 Long-Term Incentive Plan;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ratify the appointment of KPMG LLP as Northern Trust Corporations independent registered public accounting firm for the 2017 fiscal year; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: transact any other business that may properly come before the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You can, and should, vote if you were a stockholder of record at the close of business on February 27, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: March 16, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By order of the Board of Directors,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stephanie S. Greisch Corporate Secretary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The accompanying proxy is solicited on behalf of the Board of Directors (the Board) of Northern Trust Corporation (the Corporation) for use at the Corporations Annual Meeting of Stockholders to be held on Tuesday, April 25, 2017 (the Annual Meeting).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On or about March 16, 2017, we began mailing or otherwise making available our proxy materials, including a copy of our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2016, to all stockholders entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: GENERAL INFORMATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A Notice Regarding the Availability of Proxy Materials
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to rules adopted by the Securities and Exchange Commission (the SEC), for some of our stockholders we are providing access to our proxy materials via the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The rules permit us to send a Notice Regarding the Availability of Proxy Materials (the Notice) to stockholders of record and beneficial owners.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All stockholders have the ability to access the proxy materials on the website referred to in the Notice, www.proxyvote.com, or to request a printed set of proxy materials on this site or by calling toll-free 1-800-579-1639.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Complete instructions for accessing the proxy materials on the Internet or requesting a printed copy may be found in the Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, stockholders may request to receive all future proxy materials in printed form by mail or electronically by e-mail on the website above or when voting electronically.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Choosing to receive your future proxy materials by e-mail will save us the cost of printing and mailing documents to you and will reduce the impact of our annual stockholders meetings on the environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you choose to receive future proxy materials by e-mail, you will receive an e-mail next year with instructions containing a link to those materials and a link to the proxy voting site.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your election to receive proxy materials by e-mail will remain in effect until you terminate it.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who May Vote
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Record holders of the Corporations common stock at the close of business on February 27, 2017 may vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On that date, the Corporation had 229,484,933 shares of common stock outstanding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are entitled to one vote for each share of common stock that you owned of record at the close of business on February 27, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proxy card or Notice, as applicable, indicates the number of shares you are entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting Your Proxy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether or not you plan to attend the Annual Meeting, we urge you to vote your shares promptly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a stockholder of record (that is, you hold your shares of the Corporations common stock in your own name), you may vote your shares by proxy using any of the following methods:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: using the Internet site listed on the Notice or the proxy card;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: calling the toll-free telephone number listed on the proxy card; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: completing, signing, dating and returning your proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Internet and telephone voting procedures set forth on the Notice and the proxy card are designed to authenticate stockholders identities, to allow stockholders to provide their voting instructions and to confirm that their instructions have been properly recorded.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you vote by Internet or telephone, you should not return your proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a beneficial owner, also known as a street name holder (that is, you hold your shares of the Corporations common stock through a broker, bank or other nominee), you will receive from the record holder, in the form of a Notice or otherwise, voting instructions (including instructions, if any, on how to vote by Internet or telephone) that you must follow in order to have your shares voted at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the rules of various national and regional securities exchanges, brokers, banks and other nominees that hold securities on behalf of beneficial owners generally may vote on routine matters even if they have not received voting instructions from the beneficial owners for whom they hold securities, but are not permitted to vote on nonroutine matters unless they have received such voting instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the ratification of the appointment of the Corporations independent registered public accounting firm is considered to be a routine matter, each of the other matters to be presented to the stockholders at the Annual Meeting described in this Proxy Statement is considered to be a nonroutine matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thus, if you fail to provide your specific voting instructions, your broker may only vote your shares on the ratification of the appointment of the Corporations independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consequently, it is important that you communicate your voting instructions by using any of the following methods so your vote can be counted:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: using the Internet site listed on the voting instruction form;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: calling the toll-free telephone number listed on the voting instruction form; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: completing, signing, dating and returning your voting instruction form.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you own shares of common stock as a participant in The Northern Trust Company Thrift-Incentive Plan (TIP), or as a participant in any other employee benefit plan of the Corporation, your proxy card will cover the shares credited to each of your plan accounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The completed proxy card (or vote by Internet or telephone) will serve as your voting instructions to the TIP trustee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To allow sufficient time for voting by the trustee, your voting instructions must be received by 11:59 p.m, Eastern Time, on April 20, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether you vote by Internet, telephone or mail, your shares will be voted in accordance with your instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you sign date and return your proxy card without indicating how you want to vote your shares, the proxy holders will vote your shares in accordance with the following recommendations of the Board:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 1         FOR the election of each nominee for director;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 2          FOR the approval, by an advisory vote, of the 2016 compensation of the Corporations named executive officers, as disclosed in this Proxy Statement pursuant to the compensation disclosure rules of the SEC;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 3          EVERY YEAR for the frequency with which the Corporation should hold advisory votes on executive compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 4         FOR the approval of the Northern Trust Corporation 2017 Long-Term Incentive Plan; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: tem 5          FOR the ratification of the appointment of KPMG LLP as the Corporations independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proxy holders are authorized to vote as they shall determine in their sole discretion on any other business that may properly come before the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revoking Your Proxy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may revoke your proxy at any time before it is voted at the Annual Meeting by:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: sending a written notice of revocation to the Corporations Corporate Secretary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: submitting another signed proxy card with a later date;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: voting by Internet or telephone at a later date; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: attending the Annual Meeting and voting in person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold your shares in the name of your broker, bank or other nominee and wish to revoke your proxy, you will need to contact that party to revoke your proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting in Person
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may come to the Annual Meeting and vote your shares in person by obtaining and submitting a ballot that will be provided at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if your shares are held by a broker, bank or other nominee in street name, to be able to vote at the meeting you must obtain a proxy, executed in your favor, from the record holder of your shares, indicating that you were the beneficia owner of the shares at the close of business on February 27, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Householding Information
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are delivering only one Annual Report on Form 10-K and Proxy Statement (or, as applicable, the Notice) to stockholders of record who share the same address unless they have notified us that they wish to continue receiving multiple copies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This practice, known as householding,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reduces duplicate mailings, saves printing and postage costs as well as natural resources and will not affect dividend check mailings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you wish to receive separate copies of proxy materials, please contact Broadridge at 1-866-540-7095 or Broadridge, Householding Department, 51 Mercedes Way, Edgewood, NY 11717.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders who wish to receive a separate set of proxy materials now should contact Broadridge at the same telephone number or mailing address and the materials will be delivered to you promptly upon your request.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you and other stockholders of record with whom you share an address currently receive multiple copies of our proxy materials or if you hold our stock in more than one account, and, in either case, you wish to receive only a single copy of such materials in the future, please contact Broadridge at the telephone number or mailing address above with the names in which all accounts are registered and the name of the account for which you wish to receive mailings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Quorum and Vote Required for Approval
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A quorum of stockholders is necessary to hold a valid meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A quorum will exist if a majority of the outstanding shares entitled to vote at the meeting is present in person or by proxy at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions and broker nonvotes, if any, will be counted as present for purposes of establishing a quorum.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A broker nonvote will occur when a nominee holding shares for a beneficial owner does not vote on a particular proposal because the nominee does not have discretionary voting power with respect to that proposal and has not received instructions from the beneficial owner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As noted above, brokers, banks and other nominees generally cannot vote your shares on any of the matters to be presented to stockholders at the Annual Meeting described in this Proxy Statement, other than the ratification of the appointment of KPMG LLP as the Corporations independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2017, without your specific instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please return your proxy card or voting instruction form, as applicable, or vote by Internet or telephone so your vote can be counted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An inspector of election appointed for the Annual Meeting will tabulate all votes cast in person or by proxy at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the event a quorum is not present at the Annual Meeting, we expect that the Annual Meeting will be adjourned or postponed to solicit additional proxies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following table indicates the vote required for approval of each item to be presented to the stockholders at the Annual Meeting and the effect of abstentions and broker nonvotes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item    Required Vote    Effect of Abstentions and Broker Nonvotes Item 1Election of directors    Affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast with respect to each nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: See below for further detail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions with respect to a nominee will have no effect on the election of such nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker nonvotes will have no effect on the voting for this item.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 2Advisory vote on executive compensation    Affirmative vote of a majority of the shares of common stock present and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions will have the effect of a vote AGAINST this item.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker nonvotes will have no effect on the voting for this item.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 3Advisory vote on frequency of votes on executive compensation    Affirmative vote of a plurality of the shares of common stock present and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions will have no effect on the voting for this item.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker nonvotes will have no effect on the voting for this item.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 4Approval of the Northern Trust Corporation 2017 Long-Term Incentive Plan    Affirmative vote of a majority of the shares of common stock present and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions will have the effect of a vote AGAINST this item.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker nonvotes will have no effect on the voting for this item.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Item 5Ratification of the appointment of KPMG LLP as the Corporations independent registered public accounting firm for the 2017 fiscal year    Affirmative vote of a majority of the shares of common stock present and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions will have the effect of a vote AGAINST this item.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Brokers may vote uninstructed shares on this item.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the Corporations By-laws, a nominee for director in an uncontested election (such as this years election where the only nominees are those recommended by the Board) must receive the affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast with respect to his or her election at a meeting of stockholders to be elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In contested elections, the affirmative vote of a plurality of the votes cast will be required to elect a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporations Corporate Governance Guidelines require an incumbent director who fails to receive the affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast with respect to his or her election in an uncontested election at a meeting of stockholders to submit his or her resignation following certification of the stockholder vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such resignation will first be considered by the members of the Corporate Governance Committee (other than the tendering director, if applicable), who will recommend to the Board whether to accept or reject the resignation after considering all factors deemed relevant by the Committee, including, without limitation, any stated reasons as to why stockholders did not support the director whose resignation has been tendered, the length of service and qualifications of such director, the directors contributions to the Corporation and the Corporations Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board (other than the tendering director) will then act to accept or reject the Committees recommendation no later than ninety days following the date of the stockholders meeting after considering the factors considered by the Committee and such additional information and factors as the Board believes to be relevant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Solicitation of Proxies; Costs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporation will bear the cost of preparing, printing and mailing the materials in connection with this solicitation of proxies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to mailing these materials, the Corporations officers and other employees may, without being additionally compensated, solicit proxies personally and by mail, telephone or electronic communication.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporation will reimburse banks and brokers for their reasonable out-of-pocket expenses related to forwarding proxy materials to beneficial owners of stock or otherwise in connection with this solicitation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Corporation has retained Georgeson Inc. to assist in the solicitation of proxies for a fee of approximately $12,500, plus reasonable out-of-pocket expenses.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ADMITTANCE TO THE ANNUAL MEETING
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders at the close of business on the record date, February 27, 2017, or their duly appointed proxies, may attend our Annual Meeting at our corporate headquarters on April 25, 2017 at 10:30 a.m., Central Time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Registration will begin at 9:30 a.m.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our corporate headquarters are located at 50 South La Salle Street (northwest corner of La Salle Street and Monroe Street) in Chicago, Illinois.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to be admitted to the meeting, you must bring documentation showing that you owned the Corporations common stock at the close of business on the record date, February 27, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Acceptable documentation includes an admission ticket, a Notice Regarding the Availability of Proxy Materials or any other proof of ownership of the Corporations common stock at the close of business on February 27, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A brokerage statement or letter from a bank or broker reflecting your holdings at the close of business on February 27, 2017 is an example of such other proof of ownership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your admission ticket is located on the top portion of the rear side of your proxy card or on the left side of your voting instruction form if your shares are held by a broker, bank or other nominee in street name.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You will be asked to present valid picture identification, such as a drivers license or passport.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For safety and security reasons, cameras and recording devices will not be permitted in the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ITEM 1ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders will be asked to elect thirteen directors at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the thirteen nominees is currently serving as a director of the Corporation and its principal subsidiary, The Northern Trust Company (the Bank).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Included in the incumbent directors nominated for re-election are Jay L. Henderson and Michael G. OGrady, who were appointed as directors of the Corporation by the Board, effective July 18, 2016 and January 1, 2017, respectively, each in accordance with the Corporations By- laws and pursuant to the recommendation of the Corporations Chairman and Chief Executive Officer (CEO) and Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dipak C. Jain will not be standing for re-election, as he will be retiring from service as a director effective upon the conclusion of his current term at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Jain has served as member of the Board since 2004.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the thirteen director nominees has consented to serve as a director if elected at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each nominee elected as a director will serve until the next Annual Meeting of Stockholders or until his or her successor is elected and qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any nominee is unable to serve as a director at the time of the Annual Meeting, your proxy may be voted for the election of another nominee proposed by the Board or the Board may reduce the number of directors to be elected at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed further under Corporate GovernanceDirector Nominations and Qualifications, in evaluating director nominees, the Corporate Governance Committee considers a variety of factors, including relevant business and industry experience; professional background; age; current employment; community service; other board service; and racial, ethnic, and gender diversity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the thirteen director nominees possess a wide variety of experience, qualifications and skills, which will equip the Board with the collective expertise to perform its oversight function effectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the candidates also has a reputation for, and long record of, integrity and good business judgment; has experience in leadership positions with a high degree of responsibility; is free from conflicts of interest that could interfere with his or her duties to the Corporation and its stockholders; and is willing and able to make the necessary commitment of time and attention required for effective Board service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A summary of certain key experience, qualifications and skills represented by the nominees for election to the Board at the Annual Meeting, collectively, is set forth below.

sentences.text: Board Committees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The standing committees of the Board are the Audit Committee, the Business Risk Committee, the Capital Governance Committee, the Compensation and Benefits Committee, the Corporate Governance Committee, the Corporate Social Responsibility Committee and the Executive Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With the exception of the Executive Committee, all standing committees are composed solely of independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consequently, independent directors directly oversee critical matters and appropriately oversee the Chairman and CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each standing committee is governed by a written charter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These charters detail the duties and responsibilities of each committee and are available on the Corporations website at www.northerntrust.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional information regarding the roles, responsibilities and composition of the Boards standing committees is set forth
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents

sentences.text: Audit Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committees purpose is to oversee the accounting and financial reporting processes of the Corporation and its subsidiaries and the audits of the consolidated financial statements of such entities, as well as to provide assistance to the Board in fulfilling its legal and fiduciary obligations with respect to matters involving the organizations accounting, auditing, financial reporting, internal financial control and legal compliance functions, including, without limitation:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) assisting the Boards oversight of
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) the integrity of the organizations consolidated annual and quarterly financial statements and earnings releases,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the organizations compliance with legal and regulatory requirements,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) the qualifications and independence of the Corporations public accountants and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (d) the performance of the organizations internal audit function and the Corporations public accountants; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) preparing the report required to be prepared by the Committee pursuant to SEC rules for inclusion each year in the Corporations proxy statement relating to its Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that all members of the Audit Committee are independent under SEC rules and NASDAQ listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also has determined that all Audit Committee members have the financial experience and knowledge required for service on the Committee, and that Messrs. Smith, Harrison, Slark and Thompson each satisfy the definition of audit committee financial expert under SEC rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee met five times in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Business Risk Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Business Risk Committees sole and exclusive function is responsibility for the risk-management policies of the Corporations global operations and oversight of the operation of the Corporations global risk-management framework.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In furtherance of this function, the Business Risk Committee assists the Board in discharging its oversight duties with respect to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the risks inherent in the businesses of the Corporation and its subsidiaries in the following categories: credit risk, market and liquidity risk, fiduciary risk, operational risk, compliance risk and strategic risk; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the process by which risk-based capital requirements are determined.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that all members of the Business Risk Committee are independent under SEC rules and NASDAQ listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Business Risk Committee met six times in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Capital Governance Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the Capital Governance Committee is to assist the Board in discharging its oversight duties with respect to capital management and planning activities of the Corporation and its subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among other matters, the Capital Governance Committee performs the following functions:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) oversees the capital adequacy assessments, forecasting, and stress testing processes and activities of the Corporation and its subsidiaries, including with respect to the annual Comprehensive Capital Analysis and Review (CCAR) exercise, and challenges management, as appropriate, on various elements of such processes and activities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) reviews and recommends to the Board for approval the Corporations annual capital plan, including proposed capital actions, and reviews and challenges management, as appropriate, with respect to the assumptions, limitations and weaknesses related to the Corporations annual capital plan, including regarding risk identification and estimation approaches;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) receives reports on the Corporations material risks and exposures to inform decisions on capital adequacy and actions, including capital distributions;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) unless reviewed and approved by the Board, reviews and approves capital policies for the Corporation and the Bank, including the Corporations and the Banks capital management goals and targets and the Corporations payout ratios;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) reviews and discusses with management the Corporations and the Banks regulatory capital ratios and capital levels; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) reviews and recommends to the Board for approval
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) dividend declarations with respect to the Corporations common and preferred stock and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) issuances or repurchases of debt or equity securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that all members of the Capital Governance Committee are independent under SEC rules and NASDAQ listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Capital Governance Committee met ten times in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation and Benefits Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the Compensation and Benefits Committee is to assist the Board in discharging its duties and responsibilities relating to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the compensation of the directors and executive officers of the Corporation and its subsidiaries; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the employee benefit and equity-based plans of the organization.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also assists the Board with management development and succession planning, including with respect to the position of CEO, and prepares the report required to be prepared by the Committee pursuant to SEC rules for inclusion in the Corporations proxy statement relating to its Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that all members of the Compensation and Benefits Committee are independent under SEC rules and NASDAQ listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation and Benefits Committee met five times in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the Corporate Governance Committee is to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) identify and recommend to the Board candidates for nomination or appointment as directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) review the Boards committee structure and recommend appointments to committees;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) provide leadership in shaping the corporate governance of the Corporation, including through the development and recommendation to the Board of Corporate Governance Guidelines applicable to the Corporation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) advise the Board on the appointment of a successor in the event of the unanticipated death, disability or resignation of the Corporations CEO, after consultation with the Chairman of the Corporations Compensation and Benefits Committee;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) oversee the procedures relating to stockholder communications with the Board and review any proposals submitted by stockholders; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) oversee the annual evaluation of the Board and its committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that all members of the Corporate Governance Committee are independent under SEC rules and NASDAQ listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Committee met four times in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Social Responsibility Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purpose of the Corporate Social Responsibility Committee is to assist the Board in discharging its oversight duties with respect to corporate citizenship and social responsibility matters of significance to the Corporation and its subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among other matters, the Corporate Social Responsibility Committee receives and reviews reports on each of the following as they pertain to the Corporation and its subsidiaries:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) political, lobbying and other public advocacy activities, including significant trade association memberships;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) strategic philanthropy and charitable contributions;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) sustainability initiatives and other social responsibility matters of significance, including environmental, social, and governance issues;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) diversity and inclusion initiatives;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) human rights matters; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) compliance with the Community Reinvestment Act and Fair Lending laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Social Responsibility Committee also provides oversight with respect to the Corporations policies, programs and strategies in respect of each of these matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that all members of the Corporate Social Responsibility Committee are independent under SEC rules and NASDAQ listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Social Responsibility Committee met three times in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board appoints an Executive Committee so that there will be a committee of the Board empowered to act for the Board, to the full extent permitted by law, between meetings of the Board if necessary and appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Committee is composed of the Chairman of the Board and the Chair of each of the other standing committees of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Committee did not meet in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Governance Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the high standards set by our governance structure provide the foundation for the strength of our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An overview of certain key governance practices reflective of our strong governance profile is set forth below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Do                   What We Dont Do                 Majority Independent Directors       No Plurality Voting in Uncontested Director Elections   Engaged Lead Director      No Staggered Board   Frequent Executive Sessions for Independent Directors      No Poison Pill     Annual Strategic Planning Meeting with Board and Executive Officers       No Supermajority Voting Requirements   Regular Rotations of Committee Chairs      No Overboarding of Directors   Regular Reviews of Governance Documents          Annual Board and Committee Self-Evaluations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To be considered independent, the Board must affirmatively determine that a director has no relationship with the Corporation which, in the opinion of the Board, would interfere with the exercise of independent judgment in carrying out the responsibilities of a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporations Corporate Governance Guidelines require that a majority of the directors serving on the Board meet the criteria for independence under NASDAQ listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To assist the Board in making its independence determinations, the Board has adopted categorical standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under these standards, the following persons shall not be considered independent:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a director who is or was an employee or executive officer of the Corporation, or whose Family Member (as defined below) is or was an executive officer of the Corporation, at any time during the past three years;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a director who receives or has received, or whose Family Member receives or has received, compensation from the Corporation in excess of $120,000 during any period of twelve consecutive months within the past three years, other than director and committee fees, benefits under a tax-qualified retirement plan or other forms of nondiscretionary compensation; provided, however, that compensation received by a Family Member of a director for service as an employee (other than as an executive officer) of the Corporation need not be considered in determining independence;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a director who is, or whose Family Member is, a current partner of the Corporations outside auditor, or who was a partner or employee of the Companys outside auditor who worked on the Corporations audit at any time during any of the past three years;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a director of the Corporation who is, or has a Family Member who is, employed as an executive officer of another entity where at any time during the past three years any of the executive officers of the Company serve on the compensation committee of such other entity; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a director who is, or whose Family Member is, a partner in, a controlling stockholder of, or an executive officer of, any organization to which the Corporation made, or from which the Corporation received, payments for property or services in the current or any of the past three fiscal years that exceed the greater of $200,000 or 5% of the recipients consolidated gross revenue for that year, other than payments arising solely from investments in the Corporations securities or payments under nondiscretionary charitable contribution matching programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Family Member means a persons spouse, parents, children and siblings, whether by blood, marriage or adoption, or anyone residing in such persons home.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that each director serving during 2016 was, and each current director (other than Mr. Waddell, who serves as Chairman and CEO of the Corporation, and Mr. OGrady, who serves as President of the Corporation) is, independent of the Corporation in accordance with the Corporations Corporate Governance Guidelines and categorical standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the categorical standards, the Board also considers any transaction, relationship, or arrangement between the Corporation and a director that constitutes a related person transaction under the Corporations Related Person Transactions Policy, descriptions of which are provided under Related Person Transactions Policy below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In each case, the Board determined that these relationships were immaterial and did not affect any directors ability to exercise independent judgment in carrying out his or her responsibilities as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Related Person Transactions Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board, through its Audit Committee, has adopted a written Related Person Transactions Policy to govern the review, approval, and ratification of transactions to which the Corporation or its subsidiaries are party and in which any related persons have a direct or indirect material interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Related persons means the Corporations directors, nominees for director, executive officers, greater than five percent beneficial owners, members of their immediate family and any person (other than a tenant or employee) sharing their household.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Related Person Transactions Policy provides that the Corporation may undertake certain pre-approved related person transactions in the ordinary course of business without specific review, approval or ratification, including the following pre-approved transactions:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: an extension of credit by the Corporation or any of its subsidiaries to a related person that is made in the ordinary course of business on substantially the same terms, including interest rates and collateral, as those prevailing at the time for comparable loans with persons not related to the lender and does not involve more than the normal risk of collectability or present other unfavorable features;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: certain other ordinary course transactions in which the Corporation or its subsidiaries provide products or services to related persons on terms no less favorable to the Corporation and its subsidiaries as those prevailing at the time for comparable services to nonrelated persons;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a transaction involving services as a bank depositary of funds, transfer agent, registrar, trustee under a trust indenture or similar services;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a transaction where the rates or charges involved in the transaction are determined by competitive bids, or the transaction involves the rendering of services as a common or contract carrier, or public utility, at rates or charges fixed in conformity with law or governmental authority;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a transaction with another company to which a related persons only relationship is as an employee, a director, a beneficial owner of less than 10% of the companys outstanding common equity (when aggregated with all other directors, executive officers or nominees for election as a director of the Corporation), or, in the case of partnerships, a limited partner with less than 10% interest in the partnership (when aggregated with all other directors, executive officers or nominees for election as a director of the Corporation) and who is not a general partner of, or holder of another position with, that partnership, provided in each case the aggregate amount of the transaction does not exceed the greater of $200,000 or 5% of the other companys annual revenue;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: contributions or grants, or pledges of contributions or grants, by the Corporation, any of its subsidiaries, or The Northern Trust Company Charitable Trust to a charitable, nonprofit, or educational organization for which a related person serves as an executive officer, provided that the aggregate amount involved does not exceed the greater of $200,000 or 5% of the organizations total annual receipts;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: transactions where the related persons interest arises solely from the ownership of the Corporations common stock and all stockholders receive the same benefit on a pro rata basis;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: compensation paid to executive officers of the Corporation that is required to be reported in the Corporations proxy statement under Item 402 of Regulation S-K, or to executive officers that are not immediate family members of another related person and such compensation would be reported in the Corporations proxy statement under Item 402 of Regulation S-K if such executive officers were named executive officers, and the Corporations Compensation and Benefits Committee approved such compensation (or recommended it for approval by the Board); and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: compensation paid to directors of the Corporation that is required to be reported in the Corporations proxy statement under Item 402 of Regulation S-K.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any other related person transaction involving amounts in excess of $120,000 must be approved or ratified by the Audit Committee or the Audit Committee Chair.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In considering related person transactions, the Audit Committee or the Audit Committee Chair will consider all relevant facts and circumstances and approve only those related person transactions that are in, or otherwise not inconsistent with, the best interests of the Corporation and its subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, certain related persons were clients of, and/or otherwise engaged in the types of transactions identified in the bullet points above with, the Corporation or one or more of its subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporation or its subsidiaries provided financial services to each of its directors, or persons related to such directors, except for Mr. Tribbett, in the ordinary course of business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Services provided included trust and related services, brokerage services, investment management, asset servicing, asset management, credit services and other banking services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These transactions were undertaken in the ordinary course of business and were made on substantially the same terms (including interest rates and collateral for loan transactions) as those prevailing at the time for comparable transactions with other persons not related to the Corporation or any affiliated entities involved in the transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of these transactions involved more than the normal risk of collectability or presented other unfavorable features, and any extensions of credit to directors and executive officers of the Corporation were permitted under the provisions of Section 13(k) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (the Exchange Act).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of these transactions or any transactions in which the Corporation or any of its subsidiaries sold or purchased products and services to or from any of the Corporations directors, or persons or entities affiliated with its directors, were material to the Corporation or any affiliated entities involved in the transactions, and all such transactions were undertaken upon such other terms and conditions as permitted such transactions to qualify for pre-approval under the Related Person Transactions Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the foregoing, Kathleen Finley, Mr. Hendersons daughter, has been employed by the Bank since 2005, currently serving as Vice President on the Client and Partner Experience team of the Bank.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In such role, Ms. Finley earned compensation in excess of $120,000 in 2016, and received retirement, health and wellness benefits, all on comparable terms as those provided for other employees of the Bank.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the Related Person Transactions Policy, our Audit Committee considered and approved Ms. Finleys employment in conjunction with Mr. Hendersons appointment to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of the foregoing transactions require disclosure pursuant to Item 404(a) of Regulation S-K of the Exchange Act, except with respect to the compensation earned by Ms. Finley.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Sessions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent directors of the Corporation met in executive sessions separate from management six times during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Lead Director or, in his absence, another independent director designated by the Lead Director, presides at executive sessions of the independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The standing committees of the Board also regularly held executive sessions during 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These sessions were led by the respective independent committee Chairs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Leadership Structure; Lead Director
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The current leadership structure of the Board consists of a combined Chairman and CEO position and a Lead Director appointed annually by the Corporations independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that combining the positions of Chairman and CEO is the most appropriate for the Corporation at this time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Having one person as Chairman and CEO provides unified leadership and direction to the Corporation and strengthens the ability of the CEO to develop and implement strategic initiatives and respond efficiently in crisis situations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to our Corporate Governance Guidelines, the full Board is responsible for direct oversight of the strategic direction and initiatives of the Corporation and its subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes the combination of the Chairman and CEO positions is appropriate in light of the substantial independent oversight provided by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also believes that the desire for independent leadership of the Board is sufficiently achieved by the prominent role of Mr. Rowe as Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Lead Directors primary duties are described in the Corporations Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among other matters, the Lead Directors duties include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) approving meeting agendas for the Board and the nature of information sent to the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) approving Board meeting schedules to ensure that there is sufficient time for discussion of all Board agenda items;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) calling at any time deemed necessary or advisable by such Lead Director a special meeting of the Board or a special executive session of the independent directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) adding items to the agenda of any regular or special meeting of the Board deemed necessary or advisable by such Lead Director;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) presiding at all regular and special meetings of the Board at which the Chairman is not present
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) presiding at all regular and any special executive sessions of the independent directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vii) serving as a liaison between the independent directors and the Chairman and CEO;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (viii) conducting, by means of an interview with each director, including the Chairman and CEO, the Boards annual self-evaluation of its performance, as well as the Boards annual evaluation of the CEOs performance, and then providing a summary report to the Board; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ix) being available for consultation and direct communication with stockholders, as appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Rowe has served as our Lead Director since 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board provides oversight of risk management directly as well as through its Audit, Business Risk, Capital Governance and Compensation and Benefits Committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board annually approves the Corporations enterprise risk management framework, risk universe and Corporate Risk Appetite Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Risk Appetite Statement reflects the expectation that risk be consciously considered as part of the Corporations strategic decisions and in its day-to-day activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporation actively monitors employees using programs, policies, and other tools that are designed to ensure that they work within established risk frameworks and limits.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Business Risk Committee assumes primary responsibility and oversight with respect to credit risk, market and liquidity risk, fiduciary risk, operational risk, compliance risk and strategic risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee provides oversight with respect to financial reporting and legal risk, while the Compensation and Benefits Committee oversees the development and operation of the incentive compensation program of the Corporation and its subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation and Benefits Committee annually reviews managements assessment of the effectiveness of the design and performance of the incentive compensation arrangements and practices in providing incentives that are consistent with the safety and soundness of the Corporation and its subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This assessment includes an evaluation of whether these incentive compensation arrangements and practices discourage inappropriate risk- taking behavior by participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to its charter, the Compensation and Benefits Committee is required to have at least one member who is a member of the Business Risk Committee and at least one member who is a member of the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among other responsibilities, the Capital Governance Committee oversees the capital adequacy assessments, forecasting, and stress testing processes and activities of the Corporation and its subsidiaries, including the annual CCAR exercise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the Capital Governance Committee provides oversight with respect to the linkage of the Corporations material risks to capital planning and stress testing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The charters for the Audit, Business Risk, Capital Governance and Compensation and Benefits Committees provide that the Committees may meet with the individuals who supervise day-to-day risk management responsibilities of the Corporation and other members of management, consultants or advisors, as each committee deems appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a further description of the risk management policies and practices of the Corporations management, see the sections entitled Managements Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of OperationsRisk Management and  Liquidity and Capital ResourcesLiquidity Risk Management in the Corporations Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended December 31, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporation has had Corporate Governance Guidelines in place since 2000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Committee reviews and reassesses the adequacy of the Corporate Governance Guidelines at least annually and recommends any changes to the Board for approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporations Corporate Governance Guidelines embody many of the Corporations long-standing practices and incorporate policies and procedures that strengthen its commitment to corporate governance best practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A copy of the Corporate Governance Guidelines is available on the Corporations website at www.northerntrust.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Code of Business Conduct and Ethics
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of the Corporation has adopted a Code of Business Conduct and Ethics to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: promote honest and ethical conduct, including fair dealing and the ethical handling of actual or apparent conflicts of interest;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: promote full, fair, accurate, timely and understandable public disclosure about the Corporation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: promote compliance with applicable laws and governmental rules, codes and regulations wherever the Corporation does business;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ensure the protection of the Corporations legitimate business interests; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: deter wrongdoing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Code of Business Conduct and Ethics satisfies applicable SEC and NASDAQ requirements and applies to all directors, officers (including the Corporations principal executive officer, principal financial officer and principal accounting officer) and employees of the Corporation and its subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporation intends to disclose any amendments to, or waivers from, the Code of Business Conduct and Ethics for directors and executive officers by posting such information on its website.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A copy of the Code of Business Conduct and Ethics is available on the Corporations website at www.northerntrust.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management Development and Succession Planning
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is responsible for succession planning for the position of CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board, led by the Compensation and Benefits Committee, annually conducts a formal management development and succession planning review with respect to the position of the CEO and other senior officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This review focuses on CEO succession planning, as well as developing internal candidates for advancement within the Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation and Benefits Committee makes recommendations to the Board concerning management development and succession planning, which recommendations reflect the Boards annual management development and succession planning review, as well as Committee discussions with and without the CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Committee discusses succession planning in the event of the unexpected death, incapacity, or resignation of the CEO and recommends to the Board, after consultation with the Chairman of the Compensation and Benefits Committee, an appropriate successor under such circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Nominations and Qualifications
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Committee is responsible for considering, evaluating, and recommending candidates for director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee will consider persons nominated by stockholders in accordance with the nomination procedures specified in the Corporations By-laws or otherwise recommended by stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporations By-laws provide that stockholders may propose director nominations only if they give timely written notice, directed to the attention of the Corporations Corporate Secretary, not less than 120 days nor more than 150 days prior to the anniversary date of the prior years Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If such Annual Meeting of Stockholders is called for a date that is not within thirty days before or after the anniversary date of the prior years Annual Meeting of Stockholders, notice by the stockholder in order to be timely must be received within ten days after notice of such subsequent Annual Meeting of Stockholders is mailed or public disclosure of the date of such Annual Meeting of Stockholders is made, whichever occurs first.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In either case, the notice must contain the information required by the Corporations By-laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders may also recommend candidates for director by following the procedures for communicating with directors described below under Communications with the Board and Independent Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In its evaluation of director candidates, including persons recommended by stockholders, the Corporate Governance Committee considers the factors specified in the Corporations Corporate Governance Guidelines to ensure the Board has a diversity of perspectives and backgrounds, including the nature of the expertise and experience required for the performance of the duties of a director of a corporation engaged in the Corporations business and such matters as relevant business and industry experience, professional background, age, current employment, community service and other board service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also considers the racial, ethnic, and gender diversity of the Board in assessing candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee seeks to identify as candidates for director persons with a reputation for, and record of, integrity and good business judgment who:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) have experience in positions with a high degree of responsibility and are leaders in the organizations with which they are affiliated;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) are free from conflicts of interest that could interfere with a directors duties to the Corporation and its stockholders; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) are willing and able to make the necessary commitment of time and attention required for effective Board service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also takes into account a candidates level of financial literacy, and monitors the mix of skills and experience of the directors in order to ensure the Board has the necessary collective expertise to perform its oversight function effectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following its evaluation process, the Committee recommends director nominees to the full Board, and the Board makes the final determination of director nominees based on its consideration of the Committees recommendation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder Engagement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporation recognizes the importance of engaging with stockholders and other key constituents.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Open and constructive dialogue with stockholders helps further their understanding of our performance and strategies and allows us to receive direct feedback on issues relating to the Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, it is the Corporations long-standing practice to engage proactively and routinely with stockholders throughout the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This practice continued in 2016, with our CEO and/or CFO engaging with stockholders representing approximately 40% of our outstanding shares regarding matters pertaining to the Corporations performance, strategies and governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Communications with the Board and Independent Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders and other interested persons may communicate with any of the Corporations directors, including the Lead Director or the independent directors as a group, by writing a letter addressed to the applicable director(s), c/o Northern Trust Corporation, 50 South La Salle Street, M-9, Chicago, Illinois 60603, Attention: Corporate Secretary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any stockholder or other interested person who has a particular concern regarding accounting, internal accounting controls, or other audit matters that he or she wishes to bring to the attention of the Audit Committee may communicate those concerns to the Audit Committee or its Chairman, using the address indicated above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporations Corporate Secretary will forward communications to the appropriate member or members of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Secretary need not forward or retain any communications determined to be mass mailings, routine solicitations for business or contributions, or communications determined not to be relevant to the performance of the duties of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Securities Transactions Policy and Procedures and Policy Against Hedging
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Securities Transactions Policy and Procedures prohibits directors, employees, including our named executive officers, and certain of their family members from purchasing or selling any type of security, whether issued by us or another company, while such persons are aware of material nonpublic information relating to the issuer of the security and from providing such material nonpublic information to any person who may trade while aware of such information.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This policy also prohibits directors, employees, and certain of their family members from engaging in short selling, margining, pledging or hypothecating the Corporations securities, and from trading in options, warrants, puts, calls or similar instruments on the Corporations securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ITEM 2ADVISORY VOTE ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to Section 14A of the Exchange Act, and the rules and regulations promulgated thereunder by the SEC, the Corporation is required to include in this Proxy Statement a separate resolution, subject to an advisory vote, to approve the compensation of our named executive officers as disclosed in this Proxy Statement (commonly referred to as a Say-on-Pay advisory vote).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In a nonbinding, advisory vote on the frequency of Say-on-Pay votes held at our 2011 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, stockholders voted in favor of conducting Say-on-Pay votes annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of this result, and other factors considered by the Board the Corporation has held Say-on-Pay votes on an annual basis since 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the Board is requesting that stockholders vote FOR approval of the following resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Resolved, that the compensation paid to the Corporations named executive officers, as disclosed in its Proxy Statement dated March 16, 2017, pursuant to Item 402 of Regulation S-K of the Exchange Act, including the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, compensation tables, and narrative discussion, is hereby APPROVED.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As an advisory vote, this proposal is not binding on the Corporation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the vote is nonbinding, the Board and the Compensation and Benefits Committee value the opinions of our stockholders and, consistent with past practice, will consider the outcome of the vote when determining compensation policies and making future compensation decisions for our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporations executive compensation program and the framework used in evaluating and making 2016 compensation decisions for our named executive officers are described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis that begins on page 30 of this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A proposal regarding the frequency with which Say-on-Pay votes should be held is included as Item 3 in this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board unanimously recommends that you vote FOR this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ITEM 3ADVISORY VOTE ON THE FREQUENCY OF STOCKHOLDER VOTES ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATIO
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to Section 14A of the Exchange Act, and the rules and regulations promulgated thereunder by the SEC, the Corporation is required to include in this Proxy Statement a separate resolution, subject to an advisory vote, on the frequency with which stockholders shall conduct advisory Say-on-Pay votes on executive compensation, such as the proposal in Item 2 above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The advisory vote on the frequency of Say-on-Pay votes is a nonbinding vote as to how often Say-on-Pay votes should occur: every year, every two years or every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 14A of the Exchange Act requires the Corporation to hold an advisory vote on the frequency of Say-on-Pay votes at least once every six years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We most recently held such an advisory vote at our 2011 Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At that meeting, stockholders voted in favor of conducting Say-on-Pay votes annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In light of this result, and other factors considered by the Board, the Board determined that the Corporation would hold Say-on-Pay votes on an annual basis until the next advisory vote on such frequency.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board continues to believe that an annual Say-on-Pay vote will allow us to obtain information on stockholders views of the compensation of our named executive officers on an appropriate basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, we believe an annual Say-on-Pay vote aligns with our objective to engage in regular dialogue with our stockholders on corporate governance and executive compensation matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the Board recommends an annual Say-on-Pay vote, stockholders are not voting to approve or disapprove the Boards recommendation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rather, stockholders are being asked to vote on the following resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Resolved, that the stockholders of Northern Trust Corporation determine, on an advisory basis, that the frequency with which the stockholders shall have an advisory vote on executive compensation set forth in the Corporations Prox Statement for its annual meeting of stockholders is
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) every year,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) every two years, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) every three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: he choice which receives the highest number of votes will be deemed the choice of the stockholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the vote on this proposal is nonbinding, the Board and the Compensation and Benefits Committee value the opinions of our stockholders and, consistent with past practice, will consider the outcome of the vote when determining the frequency with which to hold Say-on-Pay votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board unanimously recommends that you vote for the EVERY YEAR alternative with respect to the frequency with which the Corporation should hold advisory votes on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Financial Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we remained focused on the three pillars of our financial strategy:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Achieve Growth across the business, as demonstrated by continued growth in revenue and trust, investment and other servicing fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Improve Profitability and Productivity, as demonstrated by our growth in net income and pre-tax income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we made meaningful investments in our people and technology to support the continued growth of our businesses, the impact of which slowed our improvement in pre-tax margin and noninterest expense as a percentage of trust, investment and other servicing fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation decisions made with respect to each of our named executive officers for 2016 reflect such slowed improvement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We remain focused on improving these metrics going forward.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Increase Stockholder Returns through an improved return on equity, with return on equity moving further within ou target range of 10%15%, and increases in dividends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our overall financial performance compares favorably with that of our peer group discussed on page 39.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our average annual returns on equity for the three- and five-year periods ended December 31, 2016, were 11.1% and 10.5%, respectively, compared to peer-group medians of 9.7% and 9.8%, respectively.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, our average annual revenue growth of 5.5%, 6.7% and 5.7% for the one-, three- and five-year periods ended December 31, 2016, respectively, significantly outpaced the peer-group medians of (0.1)%, 0.8% and 1.4%.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We achieved these financial results while continuing to maintain strong capital ratios, with all ratios exceeding those required for classification as well capitalized under federal bank regulatory capital requirements.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN
